intro: Agdestis, commonly known as the silver leaf plant, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its silvery-gray foliage, which gives it a distinctive appearance. The plants typically have narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produce small, daisy-like flowers. Agdestis species are often found in arid or semi-arid regions, thriving in well-drained soils. They are valued for their ornamental appeal and ability to withstand drought conditions.
